text:
Hi, 
Here is something we experienced this month: 
I noticed that most Win11 22h2 machines we manage were not being offered
Novembers updates. Looking in our RMM history, I see were some did get November
CU, but it was not being offered anymore. 
They were being offered the upgrade to 23H2. We’re not quite ready for that, and
it’s not being pushed with our RMM. 
Bottom line these machines are not being offered November, and we’re not pushing
23h2; something needs to give. 
I changed the Target version, and checked for updates again, and the November
updates were being offered. 
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate] 
"ProductVersion"="Windows 11" 
"TargetReleaseVersion"=dword:00000001 
"TargetReleaseVersionInfo"="22H2" 
If I recall, Windows 10 did not act like this. CUs would be offered, even if the
next version was available (or even targeted), but maybe I’m wrong. 
Thanks,
Shimon 
IntelliComp Technologies 
Your Satisfaction Is Our Resolution 
Shimon Kerzner 
Director of Proactive Services, IntelliComp Technologies 
Phone 
 [tel:4104847270,,311] 
Email 
 
Website 
https://www.intellicomp.net/
 
Address 
1700 Reisterstown Road # 203 Baltimore, MD 21208 
IMPORTANT: The contents of this email and any attachments are confidential. They
are intended for the named recipient(s) only. If you have received this email by
mistake, please notify the sender immediately and do not disclose the contents
to anyone or make copies thereof. 
--
%40BY1PR22MB4040.namprd22.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 - November CU or 23H3 - CHOOSE!
